Dispersion requirements will replace the 2+2 rule in all public spaces, such as stores, service points and public-use spaces at shopping centres, as well as at casinos and slot machine locations. description: With effect from 19 June, the Government of the Republic decided to replace the 2+2 rule with a requirement for people to disperse. This means that a safe distance between people must continue to be maintained, but the state no longer requires compliance with the 2+2 rule, as Estonian residents understand and accept the need to keep their distance. The requirement will apply in public saunas, spas, swimming pools and water parks as well as bowling alleys, billiard rooms and children's playrooms. It will also apply in basic schools, upper secondary schools, vocational education institutions and higher education institutions, as well as in organising the activities of continuing education institutions, hobby schools and open youth centres. It will also extend to youth camps and student camps, sports activities and visits to museums and exhibitions.
